summary: 04/19/2013: Police thwarted a potential bomb attack when they engaged in a firefight with the alleged assailants of the Boston Marathon bombings, Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, in Watertown, Massachusetts, United States. Shortly after hijacking a civilian vehicle, the suspects were confronted by police, leading to a firefight that resulted in the death of Tamerlan Tsarnaev. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev and 16 police officers were injured in the exchange. One of the injured officers, Dennis Simmonds, succumbed to his injuries on April 10, 2014. During the encounter, the suspects hurled explosives at the officers. It was later revealed that the Tsarnaev brothers were plotting to use the explosives to carry out an attack in an unconfirmed location. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was arrested later that evening after he was discovered hiding in a boat that was parked in a Watertown, Massachusetts, resident's backyard. Tsarnaev had written a claim of responsibility on the side of the boat. On July 10, 2013, Dzhokhar Tsarnaev pleaded not guilty to 30 federal counts related to the Boston attacks, including one for the use of a weapon of mass destruction.
motive: Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in response to his belief that the United States (US) was allegedly killing innocent members of the Muslim community.
weapdetail: A pressure cooker bomb and five pipe bombs were to be used in the attack.
scite1: "Timeline: The Boston Marathon bombing, manhunt and investigation," CNN Wire, May 2, 2013.

summary: 05/20/2013: A letter containing ricin was mailed to United States President, Barack Obama, in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The letter caused no injuries as it was intercepted before it could reach the President. This was one of three related attacks targeting pro-gun control political and social figures on this day. The letter warned the President of future attacks if he pursued a gun control agenda. Shannon Richardson, an American television actress, was arrested on June 7, 2013 in connection with the incident.
motive: Sources stated that the letters contained anti-gun control rhetoric in their message and threatened future attacks if gun control legislation was pursued.
weapdetail: Ricin in a letter was used in the attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Richardson claimed she had sent the letters in order to frame her husband.

summary: 04/12/2014: Several hundred anti-government militia members engaged in an armed standoff with federal and local law enforcement officials along I-15, near Bunkerville, Nevada, United States. The standoff took place against the backdrop of a years-long dispute over cattle grazing rights and federal government jurisdiction between the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) and rancher Cliven Bundy. Militia members and demonstrators armed with firearms including AR-15 and AK-47 rifles took aim at BLM officers overseeing the seizure of Bundy's cattle. They made anti-government statements on camera and posted online. At least two participants were convicted of charges related to threatening, intimidating, and assaulting federal law enforcement officers. No casualties were reported; however, BLM ended the round-up and released the cattle due to concerns about the safety of officers and the public.
motive: Cliven Bundy, an anti-government extremist, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated "This is a lot bigger deal than just my cows. It's a statement for freedom and liberty and the Constitution." Moreover, sources noted that the incident was related to Bundy's defiance to pay fees for his "cattle grazing on public land."
scite1: "Bundy follower gets 68 years for role in armed Nevada standoff," Reuters News, July 26, 2017.

Rodger posted videos on the internet and wrote a lengthy manifesto detailing his plans and motivations for the attack. His ideology reflected a misogynist and white supremacist narrative seen in online message forums where participants self-identify as "involuntarily celibate" (incel).

The assailant was shot and killed when police responded, but there were no other casualties reported. No group claimed responsibility for the incidents; however, the deceased assailant was identified as Larry McQuilliams. Sources suspected that the incidents were fueled by anti-government and anti-immigration sentiments.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been the result of Larry Steven McQuilliams' anti-government and anti-immigration sentiments.
scite1: "Bomb squad called in after Austin police kill gunman," CNN, November 28, 2014.

summary: 12/07/2014: An assailant set fire to an under-construction apartment complex in Los Angeles, California, United States. There were no casualties, but the fire caused an estimated $100 million in damage to the complex and surrounding buildings. Dawud Abdulwali claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in response to the shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri in August 2014.

motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Dawud Abdulwali, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in response to the death of Michael Brown by a police officer in Ferguson, Missouri in August 2014.
scite1: "Man Convicted of Starting Massive Da Vinci Fire in Downtown L.A. Sentenced to 15 Years in Prison: DA's Office," KTLA 5 News, April 24, 2017.

No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to an individual, identified as Justin Nojan Sullivan. Sources posited that Sullivan, who was arrested in connection to the attack, targeted John Bailey Clark Jr. in order to steal money from the victim, so he could purchase a rifle to carry out an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) inspired attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources posited that an individual, identified as Justin Nojan Sullivan, targeted John Bailey Clark Jr. in order to steal money from the victim, so he could purchase a rifle to carry out an Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) inspired attack.

summary: 12/20/2014: An assailant opened fire on New York City Police Department officers while they were sitting in their vehicle in Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood, Brooklyn, New York City, United States. Officers Wenjian Liu and Rafael Ramos were killed in the attack. The assailant, identified as Ismaaiyl Brinsley, claimed responsibility and stated that the attack was carried out to avenge the deaths of Michael Brown and Eric Garner at the hands of the authorities.

summary: 01/06/2015: An explosive device detonated outside of the offices of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) in Colorado Springs, Colorado, United States. No one was injured in the blast, but the building suffered minor damages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, law enforcement officials arrested Thaddeus Murphy in connection with the attack. Murphy admitted to the bombing, but claimed that a tax preparation office, not the NAACP, was the target.

addnotes: There is doubt this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Sources suggest that the attack may have been related to a personal feud with a tax accountant.

summary: 10/01/2015: An assailant, identified as Christopher Harper-Mercer, entered a classroom at Umpqua Community College and held an unknown number of students and staff hostage in Roseburg, Oregon, United States. Armed with six firearms, the assailant shot and killed nine people and injured at least seven others. He exchanged fire with responding police officers before shooting himself and committing suicide. Statements Harper-Mercer made in his manifesto and posted online reflect a fixation on mass shootings, as well as a misogynist and white supremacist narrative seen in message forums where participants self-identify as "involuntarily celibate" (incel).
motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Christopher Harper-Mercer, claimed responsibility for the incident and wrote a manifesto and posted statements online reflecting a fixation on mass shootings, as well as a misogynist and white supremacist narrative seen in message forums where participants self-identify as "involuntarily celibate."

addnotes: The victims included assistant professor Lawrence Levine and students Lucero Alcaraz, Quinn Glenn Cooper, Jason Dale Johnson, Treven Taylor Anspach, Kim Saltmarsh Dietz, Rebecka Ann Carnes, Lucas Eibel, Sarena Dawn Moor, and Chris Mintz. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the lowest reliable estimates are reported here.

summary: 06/12/2016: An assailant armed with an assault rifle and a handgun opened fire on customers at Pulse, a gay nightclub, in Orlando, Florida, United States. summary: 05/16/2017: Assailants shot and killed Broadwater County Deputy Sheriff Mason Moore when he attempted to pull over their vehicle along Highway 287 in Three Forks, Montana, United States. summary: 05/19/2017: An assailant, identified as Devon Arthurs, shot and killed Jeremy Himmelman and Andrew Oneschuk at their shared apartment in Tampa, Florida, United States. This was one of two attacks by Arthurs on the same day. Arthurs claimed responsibility for the attack and stated that he had targeted Himmelman and Oneschuk, who were two of his roommates as well as alleged neo-Nazis and fellow members of the Atomwaffen Division, because they planned to carry out terrorist attacks that he wanted to prevent. Arthurs also claimed that his roommates had "disrespected" his conversion to Islam in the year prior to the attack, and that he was frustrated about global anti-Muslim sentiment and United States airstrikes in the Muslim world. A judge initially ruled that Arthurs was incompetent to stand trial due to mental illness. As of August 2019 the status of Arthurs' competency for trial was under review, but unresolved.

summary: 10/01/2017: An assailant opened fire from the Mandalay Bay Hotel on the Route 91 Harvest Festival concert in Las Vegas, Nevada, United States. At least 59 people were killed and more than 850 other people were injured in the assault. The assailant shot and killed himself before police reached him. Authorities identified the assailant as Stephen Paddock. A witness claimed that in the weeks before the attack she overheard Paddock espousing anger over the 1990s standoffs in Waco, Texas and Ruby Ridge, Idaho. A second witness reported that Paddock expressed concern over the United States government "confiscating guns" and that "somebody has to wake up the American public and get them to arm themselves." However, the Federal Bureau of Investigation Behavioral Analysis Unit ultimately determined that "there was no single or clear motivating factor" and that Paddock "was not seeking to further any religious, social, or political agenda."

Authorities could not verify witness statements alluding to a possible motive and the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Behavioral Analysis Unit determined that "Paddock was not seeking to further any religious, social, or political agenda" in the attack. Amaq News Agency, the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) media wing, claimed that Paddock, the assailant, was a "soldier of the caliphate." However, authorities dismissed this claim. Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the most recent reliable estimates are reported here. summary: 02/14/2018: An assailant armed with a semi-automatic rifle entered Building 12 at Stoneman Douglas High School and opened fire on students and teachers in Parkland, Florida, United States. At least 17 people were killed and 17 other people were injured in the assault. The assailant escaped the building and was arrested a few hours later. Authorities identified the assailant as Nikolas Cruz, noting that he possessed "racist, homophobic and anti-Semitic views." and that he had etched swastikas into his ammunition magazines.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that Nikolas Cruz possessed "racist, homophobic and anti-Semitic views."

addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. It is unclear if Cruz's white supremacist beliefs motivated him to carry out the attack or if he was motivated simply by the desire to carry out a school shooting. Additionally, Cruz stated that he was hearing voices in his head, however, authorities doubted that he had a legitimate mental health disorder. The victims included Alyssa Alhadeff, Scott Beigel, Martin Duque, Nicholas Dworet, Aaron Feis, Jaime Guttenberg, Chris Hixon, Luke Hoyer, Cara Loughran, Gina Montalto, Joaquin Oliver, Alaina Petty, Meadow Pollack, Helena Ramsay, Alex Schachter, Carmen Schentrup, and Peter Wang.

summary: 10/22/2018: A letter bomb was discovered and defused in the mailbox of George Soros, a billionaire and philanthropist, in Katonah, New York, United States. This was one of 16 coordinated mail bomb attacks between October 22, 2018 and November 1, 2018 that targeted critics of President Donald Trump. Cesar Altieri Sayoc was arrested in connection with the incidents. Sources noted that Sayoc's vehicle was covered in right-wing paraphernalia.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that "Right wing paraphernalia" was found covering Cesar Altieri Sayoc's van and he was identified as a vocal Trump supporter.
weapdetail: A six-inch PVC pipe filled with pyrotechnic powder, fertilizer, pool chemicals, and broken glass as shrapnel was used in the attack. The device was connected to a small battery and an inoperative digital clock and mailed in a manila envelope.

summary: 10/27/2018: An assailant opened fire on a baby-naming ceremony at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Squirrel Hill, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. At least eleven people were killed and seven other people, including the assailant and four police officers, were injured in the assault and ensuing 20-minute siege with police. Robert D. Bowers claimed responsibility before the attack on social media platform Gab, stating "I can't sit by and watch my people get slaughtered. Screw your optics, I'm going in." Sources also noted that Bowers shouted "all Jews must die" during the incident and that he had a history of anti-Semitic rhetoric on social media.
motive: An unaffiliated individual, identified as Robert D. Bowers, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated on social media that "Hebrew Immigrant Aid Society (HIAS) likes to bring invaders in that kill our people" and "I canât sit by and watch my people get slaughtered. Screw your optics, Iâm going in." Sources also noted that Bowers yelled "All Jews must die!" during the attack.
weapdetail: A Colt AR-15 semi-automatic rifle and three Glock .357-caliber semi-automatic handguns were used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims included Joyce Feinberg, Richard Gottfried, Rose Mallinger, Jerry Rabinowitz, Cecil Rosenthal, David Rosenthal, Bernice Simon, Sylvan Simon, Daniel Stein, Melvin Wax, and Irving Younger.
scite1: "10 people killed in Pittsburgh synagogue shooting, official says," CNN, October 27, 2018.

Authorities identified the assailant as Scott Paul Beierle, who was described as a misogynist that identified as an involuntary celibate.

He also spoke out in his videos against illegal immigration, interracial couples, Obamacare, police, and racial diversity.

summary: 12/20/2018: An assailant armed with a gun and spare magazine attacked two men laying concrete in a nearby driveway after returning to the area where the men previously had verbal altercation in Reisterstown, Baltimore County, Maryland, United States. One of the workers and the assailant were injured in the attack. During the attack, the assailant harassed the workers, repeatedly saying âgo back to Africaâ and ââthe n-wordâ.â The assailant was identified as Brandon Higgs and arrested shortly after the incident. Higgs had been involved with neo-Nazi groups and had a tattoo of a white nationalist symbol. Higgs was found guilty on several charges, including hate crimes, on September 23, 2020 and sentenced to 25 years in prison.

motive: The assailant, Brandon Higgs, repeatedly shouted âgo back to Africaâ and âthe n-wordâ during the attack. Sources stated that Higgs had a white nationalist symbol tattooed on his arm. Sources also stated that Higgs had ties to Neo-Nazi organizations.

summary: 01/00/2019: Sometime between January 1, 2019 and January 31, 2019, an assailant forced his girlfriend at gunpoint to wear a Schutzstaffel (SS) hat inside his residence in Green Township, New Jersey, United States. The assailant took photos of the incident and later posted the photos on a fake Instagram account and sent the photos to her Jewish employer after the couple broke up. Michael V. Zaremski claimed responsibility for the incident. Sources noted that Zaremski processed "a large collection of white supremacy and Nazi materials" and the victim stated that he had an "obsession with Adolf Hitler."
motive: Michael V. Zaremski, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and forced his ex-girlfriend to wear a Schutzstaffel (SS) hat and then proceeded to take a photo of her and create a fake Instagram account for her in which he followed her Jewish employer. During the incident he also told her that "a womanâs place is to do what the man says." Sources also noted that Zaremski processed "a large collection of white supremacy and Nazi materials" and his ex-girlfriend stated that he had an "obsession with Adolf Hitler."
weapdetail: A 9-mm handgun was used in the attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. It is unclear if the attack was meant to target groups beyond the immediate target of the assailant's girlfriend.

The assailant attempted to light the device by setting fire to a Christian religious pamphlet left in the nozzle of the canister, but the attempt failed. John Michael Rathbun was identified as the assailant through DNA evidence. Sources noted that Rathbun, who had a history of anti-Semitic and racist posts on the internet, including an April 2 online calendar event titled "Nâ¦..r killing day" and an April 3 event titled "Jew killing day." Authorities suspected that Rathbun was part of an unnamed white supremacist group that discussed using explosives to carry out mass casualty attacks against religious and racial minorities. An unidentified member of the group posted online in March 2020 that the group should target "that jew nursing home in Longmeadow Massachusetts" which authorities suspect was in reference to Ruth's House.

Authorities believed that he attempted to steal the helicopter to aid in his attack on the police station and hospital.

summary: 05/29/2020: Assailants opened fire on federal security officers outside of the Ronald V. Dellums Federal Building in Oakland, California, United States. summary: 05/29/2020: An assailant armed with a kitchen knife attempted to stab a police officer outside the City Hall building in Temple Terrace, Florida, United States. motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities reconstructed a torn-up note discovered the residence of Heba Momtaz Alazhari, an unaffiliated individual, stating "I want to do jihad and I must but all I see I [missing piece] do is take the kitchen [missing piece] and [missing piece]ttack the police." Authorities suspected that the attack was carried out in revenge for the arrest of her brother, Muhammed Momtaz Al-Azhari, who was detained five days prior to the attack for plotting an attack inspired by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

Dzenan Camovic, who allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" before carrying out the attack, was indicted in connection with the incident. summary: 06/05/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle through the front doors of a Target located at 2030 Hammond Square Drive in Hammond, Louisiana, United States. The assailant then exited the vehicle, walked/ran through the store, and exited out of the back. He attempted to carjack various vehicles before he was arrested by police officers. During the incident the assailant also dropped four suspicious packages that he wanted people to believe were explosive devices. None of the packages contained explosive material. At least one person was injured by shards of glass when the assailant initially drove into the store. The assailant was identified as Walter Allbritton III. Allbritton posted multiple videos on Facebook Live during the attack and made various comments about the police and wondering whether he would be shot.

Sergeant Damon Gutzwiller was killed and two other officers and the assailant were injured in the ambush. Authorities arrested Steven Carrillo in connection with the attack. Sources stated that Carrillo was a member of the Boogaloo movement and that he wrote phrases in support of the group at the scene of the attack.
motive: Steven Carrillo, a member of the Boogaloo movement, wrote "boog" and "I became unreasonable" using his own blood at the scene of the attack. Sources stated that Carrillo was a member of a Facebook group affiliated with the Boogaloo movement.
weapdetail: Thrown pipe bombs and a homemade AR-15-style assault rifle using 9-mm ammunition and equipped with a silencer were used in the attack.
addnotes: The victims included Sergeant Damon Gutzwiller.
scite1: "Airman charged with murder of federal officer at courthouse," Associated Press Newswires, June 16, 2020.

summary: 06/07/2020: An assailant drove his vehicle into a group of Black Lives Matter protestors in Lakeside, Virginia, United States. At least three civilians were injured in the attack. Harry Rogers, a Ku Klux Klan (KKK) member, was convicted of carrying out the attack. Sources also noted that Rogers posted on social media before and after the incident.
motive: Harry Rogers, a self-proclaimed leader of the Ku Klux Klan, claimed responsibility for the incident in a video and stated "They scattered like cockroaches. Itâs kind of funny if you ask me." Authorities found a copy of "The Practice of Klanishness," a book laying out the ideology of the Ku Klux Klan, in Rogers' glove compartment.
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A blue Chevrolet Silverado 2500 pickup truck was used in the attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority reliable estimates are reported here.
scite1: "An 'admitted leader of the KKK' is sentenced to 6 years in prison for driving his truck through Black Lives Matter protesters," CNN Wire, August 12, 2020.

summary: 06/10/2020: An assailant opened fire on the police station in Paso Robles, California, United States. One police officer was injured while responding to the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Mason James Lira, who was later killed in a police operation on June 11, 2020.
corp1: San Luis Obispo County Sheriff's Department
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Sources noted that the assailant had a long history of mental illness and institutionalization, and that this incident may have been a suicide attempt with a goal of taking out as many police as possible.
scite1: "Authorities: Suspect in ambush on California deputy is dead," Associated Press Newswires, June 12, 2020.

summary: 06/20/2020: Assailants used a racial slur before shooting DeJuan Young as he was leaving the Capitol Hill Organized Protest zone (CHOP) in Seattle, Washington, United States. Young was injured in the assault. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to White extremists.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, the victim stated that the assailants used a racial slur during the attack.
scite1: "Seattle police investigate reported shooting in CHOP zone Sunday," KIRO-TV, June 22, 2020.

summary: 07/03/2020: An assailant intentionally rammed his truck into a motorcycle driver in Taycheedah, Wisconsin, United States. The motorcycle driver, identified as Phillip Thiessen, was killed in the assault. Police arrested Daniel Navarro in connection with the attack. Navarro stated that he targeted a motorcycle because he wanted to kill the person and targeted a Harley-Davidson because of their racist culture. He also stated that he carried out the attack because of the world being created by President Donald Trump and white people. Furthermore, he asserted that he had thoughts of causing a vehicle accident earlier in the day before he eventually carried out the attack.
motive: Daniel Navarro, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility and stated that the incident was in retaliation for "the world we are living in," created by "Donald Trump and white people." Navarro intentionally targeted a Harley-Davidson motorcycle because "only white people drive Harleys," and that he believes people who drive Harley-Davidson motorcycles are typically "white racists."
weaptype1_txt: Vehicle (not to include vehicle-borne explosives, i.e., car or truck bombs)
weapdetail: A pickup truck was used in the attack.
scite1: "Mexican American man charged with hate crime in fatal crash," Associated Press Newswires, July 10, 2020.

summary: 07/04/2020: Assailants assaulted Vauhxx Booker at Lake Monroe in Bloomington, Indiana, United States. Booker, an African-American activist, was on his way to a Lunar Eclipse viewing party at the lake when he had a confrontation with the assailants, who were claiming that the victims were trespassing on private property. During the confrontation, several men grabbed Booker and pinned him against a tree and began assaulting him and threatening to break his arm. One assailant even asked another person to grab a noose. Booker was eventually freed from the assailants by his companions. In the video the assailants can be seen attacking the victim and can be heard screaming several racial slurs and denigrating the victims. Sean Purdy and Jerry Cox were arrested and charged in connection with the attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that the assailants shouted "white power" and racial slurs during the attack, and threatened to "get a noose."
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Sources noted the assailants were intoxicated at the time of the attack, and it was unclear whether the attack was spontaneous.
scite1: "2 men charged in assault on Black man at Indiana lake," Associated Press Newswires, July 17, 2020.

summary: 07/09/2020: An assailant, that had previously made threats to bomb government buildings (the Treasury Department in Harrisburg and the CIA building in Langley, Virginia), was identified and pulled over by police officers while driving in his vehicle along Washington Road in Mt. Lebanon, Pennsylvania, United States. In a subsequent search of the vehicle, authorities discovered 30 explosive devices as well as bomb-making materials and remote detonators. The assailant was identified as Kurt James Cofano. Cofano had previously threatened to attack BLM protestors as well as his threats against government buildings.

summary: 09/07/2020: Assailants opened fire on the house of an African American family in Warren, Michigan, United States. There were no casualties in the attack. Michael Frederick Jr, a white extremist, was charged and sentenced for both incidents.

Sources suspected that the assailant targeted the residence because it had a "Black Lives Matter" sign in the window.
addnotes: The victims include Candace Hall and Eddie Hall. The series of related incidents targeting the family includes both 202009070022 and 202009100017.
scite1: "Michigan Family Target of Alleged Hate Crime After Shots Fired at Their Home, Rock Thrown Through Window," The Root, September 11, 2020.

summary: 09/19/2020: An assailant mailed a letter containing ricin addressed to President Donald Trump at the White House in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The letter, which also contained an explicit death threat against President Trump, was intercepted by security officials. Pascale Ferrier, a Canadian citizen, was arrested for sending the letter as she attempted to illegally cross into the United States from Canada with an automatic weapon. A Twitter account linked to Ferrier included similar language to the ricin letter, including calling the President âan ugly tyrant clown.â Ferrier has also been charged with sending a second ricin letter to a police station in Mission, Texas, United States out of personal enmity after being deported in 2019 for an expired visa and weapons charges.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources stated that a Twitter account linked to the assailant, Pascale Ferrier, encouraged violence against President Donald Trump and referred to him as a "ugly tyrant clown."
weapdetail: A letter containing ricin was used in the attack.
scite1: "Ricin Is Said to Have Been Sent to White House," The New York Times, September 19, 2020.

summary: 09/23/2020: Assailants sprayed pro-Biden, Black Lives Matter, and anarchist graffiti on a garage before setting fire to the garage, two trucks, a trailer, and two President Donald Trump flags at a home in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, United States. There were no reported casualties in the fire. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources suspected the involvement of anti-Trump extremists. Police noted the incident was suspicious and were unwilling to discuss any motive for the attack prior to the conclusion of the on-going investigation.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources noted that pro-Biden, Black Lives Matter, and anarchist graffiti were found out the scene of the attack. Sources doubted the veracity of the graffiti at the scene, noting the inconsistency between anarchist and pro-Biden messaging.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Police were conducting an investigation into the suspicious circumstances surrounding the fire.
scite1: "Photo of 'Biden 2020' Graffiti With Incorrect Anarchy Symbol Goes Viral," Newsweek, September 24, 2020.

A private group called "Liberty Center for God and Country" paid Aguirre more than $260,000 to carry out the incident.

summary: 11/05/2020: Authorities arrested two armed individuals who drove from Virginia and parked their vehicle near the Convention Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. They claimed they intended to "straighten things out" in the Convention Center, where votes were being counted for the United States Presidential Election which took place on November 3, 2020. Sources noted that the assailants' possessed ammunition and a lock-picking tool in their vehicle, which was adorned with a QAnon sticker.

Authorities uncovered text messages between the assailants referencing a plan to raid "a truckload of fake ballots" and believed that the assailants intended "straighten things out" in the Philadelphia Convention Center, where votes were being counted for the United States Presidential Election which took place on November 3, 2020. summary: 12/13/2020: An assailant set fire to the back door of the Martin Luther King, Jr. Community Presbyterian Church in Springfield, Massachusetts, United States. There were no reported casualties in the attack. Dushko Vulchev, an unaffiliated individual, was arrested and later indicted for this and two other attacks on the same predominately Black church in December 2020. Authorities stated that Vulchev had a history of expressing racial hatred towards Black people, including a message on his device stating "eliminate all N****s." His electronic devices also contained images of a "White Lives Matter" mural and an Adolf Hitler photo.

summary: 12/13/2020: An assailant armed with two semiautomatic handguns opened fire as people were leaving a Christmas choral concert outside the Cathedral of Saint John the Divine in Manhattan, New York City, New York, United States. In addition to the assailant's weapons, the police also recovered a backpack containing several lengths of rope, wire, lighters, tape, knives, a gasoline can, a Bible, and a note saying that he intended to take hostages. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, Luis Vasquez, an unaffiliated individual, claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for the alleged treatment of Latin America. In reference to US banks and corporations, Vasquez stated "we need to seize their wealth and return it to the people of Latin America."

summary: 01/06/2021: Between 1:00 and 2:00 PM during a joint session of Congress to certify Electoral College votes, several hundred assailants attacked Capitol Police officers and breached the security perimeter of the United States Capitol complex in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. The assailants then entered the Capitol building and searched for members of Congress, assaulted responding police personnel, ransacked Congressional offices, and destroyed property for approximately four hours until 6:00 P.M. when police personnel were able to clear out the remaining assailants. One person was killed in the assault by police gunfire when she attempted to climb through a window and breach the Speaker's Lobby. At least 114 police officers and at least 68 assailants were injured, and several members of Congress and staff aides were forced to barricade during the incident. This was one of three related incidents near the U.S. Capitol on this date. In a post on the group's website two days before the attack, Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes called for members to travel to Washington, D.C. on January 6 "in support of President Trumpâs fight to defeat the enemies foreign and domestic who are attempting a coup, through the massive vote fraud and related attacks on our Republic." Rhodes and several other Oath Keepers were arrested and charged in connection with the attack. At least one member of the Proud Boys pleaded guilty to his involvement in the attack and several other members were arrested and charged. Authorities noted that members of the Proud Boys and Oath Keepers met 24 hours before the attack. Authorities also discovered several social media posts and encrypted messages that demonstrated prior coordination and planning for the January 6 attack, which was an attempt to prevent the confirmation of President Bidenâs victory and keep former President Trump in office. Additionally, several assailants displayed confederate flags and displayed Oath Keepers, Proud Boys, Three Percenters, and QAnon conspiracy theory insignias during the attack.

addnotes: The victims included police officers from the U.S. Capitol Police Department and Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) who were protecting the Capitol complex at the time of the attack.

summary: 01/06/2021: At approximately 1:00 PM, authorities discovered and defused an explosive device planted outside of the Republican National Committee (RNC) headquarters in Washington, District of Columbia, United States. This was one of two similar incidents in which explosive devices were defused near the United States Capitol while the building was breached during the Electoral College vote certification. Both devices were planted by the same assailant the prior evening. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities suspected that the devices may been planted to divert resources from the attack on the Capitol.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, authorities  suspected that the devices may been planted in an attempt to divert resources from the attack on the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021.

summary: 03/16/2021: An assailant opened fire at Young's Asian Massage in Acworth, Georgia, United States. Four people were killed and one person was injured in the attack. This was one of three related shootings targeting Asian spas in and around Atlanta on the same day. Robert Aaron Long, an unaffiliated individual, was arrested and confessed to carrying out the attacks. According to police, Long claimed to have a sex addiction and viewed the spas as a "temptation that he wanted to eliminate." Long denied that the attacks were racially motivated. However, a witness claimed that Long had stated he was going to "kill all Asians" during the incident, and sources noted that six of the victims were Asian women.

summary: 04/15/2021: An assailant opened fire on workers in the parking lot of the FedEx Ground - Plainfield Operations Center in Indianapolis, Indiana, United States. motive: Ronald Troyke, an unaffiliated individual, left a note in his residence titled "Sociopath Sovereign Citizens" in which he detailed his plans for an attack on law enforcement and stated that he wanted to "kill as many Arvada officers" as possible and that "hundreds of you pigs should be killed daily."
weapdetail: An AR-15 assault rifle and a 12-gauge semi-automatic shotgun were used in the attack.
scite1: "Bystander Who Intervened in Shooting of Officer Was Fatally Shot by Police," The New York Times, June 26, 2021.

summary: 06/26/2021: An assailant stole a box truck and crashed into a vehicle and a house at the intersection of Shirley street and Cross street in Winthrop, Massachusetts, United States. Following the crash, the assailant attempted to hijack a second vehicle, then walked down Shirley street armed with two pistols. The assailant shot and killed two black civilians before he was shot and killed by police. Two additional civilians were injured in the initial crash. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Nathan Allen. Investigators noted that Allen had kept journals he referred to as "The Allen Diaries" in which he drew swastikas and espoused white supremacist views, including the belief that racism was "healthy and natural." Sources also suspected that Allen may have intended to target nearby Jewish temples prior to the crash.
motive: No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources identified the assailant as Nathan Allen, an unaffiliated individual. weapdetail: A 9-mm semi-automatic pistol, a .45-caliber semi-automatic pistol, and a box truck were used in the attack.
scite1: "Gunman who killed two people after crashing stolen truck is fatally shot by police in Massachusetts," CNN, June 26, 2021.
